unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] taálle oke duubálle tsane uubálle
unit.utterance_translation: Grandmother, tell a story.

unit.utterance_translation: How this fighting began.

unit.utterance_translation: They began like this with what would become fighting: There was some peoples' house on a path, on which some other people passed that were going to create the warfare tree.

unit.utterance: ɨɨne pííchuhíjcyámé ɨ́jtsɨɨménémukéré iámédú íjcyámeke
unit.utterance_translation: They carried their children that were transformed in animals

unit.utterance_translation: And one man said to his wife: "These women of our relatives, they like to always ask for things."

unit.utterance_translation: "And if they ask you, don't you ask! And if they ask without listening, and if they eat, don't you eat from them!" he said.

unit.utterance_translation: And the woman said: "My husband told me that you are not supposed to ask the for anything, because they are carrying their children transformed into animals."

unit.utterance_translation: But since they very much liked to ask for things (therefore you should not let your wife ask of others' food, that can end badly!)

unit.utterance_translation: When the people passed, they did not obey anymore, they were asking.

unit.utterance_translation: And they gave them an agouti, it was a transformed child.

unit.utterance_translation: They received him and took him home and smoked him and ate him

unit.utterance_translation: And she took them down to the water and inside the intestines, inside the intestines she found pieces of manioc bread, macambo seeds, and chilli peppers.

unit.utterance_translation: another like "tchoa, tchoa, tchima, tchima"

unit.utterance_translation: Then he chewed coca.
